title: Secret Camera
subtitle: A combination of the classic Qix arcade game to adult game.

heroImage.caption: Move on the canvas to draw a closed area, but be careful not to be hit by the enemies!

sections.title: Overview
content: The game was intended to be an online mobile game at first, due to some circumstances, ended up become a singleplayer steam game.

features.name: Custom texture operation
features.description: The Qix gameplay requires custom operation to the image underneath.

features.name: Spine for Unity
features.description: Worked with artists to implement spine animations in game.

sections.title: Development Process
content: I learned to set up a nodeJS server connecting with MongoDB, but I didn't have a access to a cloud server, I had to tunnel the web request to a machine.
The game changed to single player game using Qix game mechanics after (more like Gals Panic). Images below are just some testing made by myself.

challenges.title: Challenge 1: Qix game mechanics
challenges.problem: Old games tend to have much lower resolution, modern image can easy go up to very high resolution.
challenges.solution: Downscale the actual gameplay map size. For the image display, use a mask with custom texture.

challenges.title: Challenge 2: Server connecting without a cloud service
challenges.problem: At the early stage of the project, it required a server to play. However I didn't have the access to cloud service, so I would need the game to connect to my local server somehow.
challenges.solution: I tried ngrok, Cloudflare, and other tunneling services. It was not ideal but it worked.

sections.title: What I Learned
items: Considering server load is very crucial
The skill to come up with a fun mini game concept is very useful
It was hard to find an opitimal way to implement Qix game
